definition: Hawkins or Hawking/Stephen Hawking (1942-2018), English theoretical physicist
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
John Hawkins (1532-1595), British seaman involved in sea war with Spain/Johns Hopkins (1795-1873), American entrepreneur, abolitionist and philanthropist

pinyin: Yue1 han4 · Huo4 jin1 si1 Da4 xue2

sentences.english: Lincoln's Birthday is commemorated every year in his hometown of Hodgenville.
sentences.chinese: 林肯紀念日每年都會在他的故鄉霍金維爾被慶祝。

sentences.english: Such talents as Nash and Howking can not be easily found.
sentences.chinese: 像那什和霍金那樣的人才不容易找到。

sentences.english: From Newton to Hawking, scientists love wagers.
sentences.chinese: 從牛頓到霍金，科學家們都愛打賭。

sentences.english: Owen had the operation on Monday at the Steadman Hawkins Clinic in Vail.
sentences.chinese: 週一歐文在範爾的斯蒂德曼霍金斯診所接受了手術。

sentences.english: Hawking retired last year as the Lucasian Chair of Mathematics at Cambridge University after 30 years in the position.
sentences.chinese: 霍金去年從劍橋大學盧卡斯數學教授的職位上退休了。

sentences.english: "I see great dangers for the human race, " Hawking said.
sentences.chinese: “我看到人類生存存在巨大危險，”霍金說。

sentences.english: You know Deacon Hawkins isn't asking somebody every day to go sleighing with him.
sentences.chinese: 你知道執事霍金斯的要求是每天都會跟他去雪橇。

sentences.english: is best known for his book A Brief History of Time.
sentences.chinese: 霍金教授因其《時間簡史》一書而名揚四海。

sentences.english: Hawking said it was “amazing” to float free, however briefly.
sentences.chinese: 雖然短暫，但霍金說自由飄浮“不可思議”。

sentences.english: Hawking's god is a god-of-the-gaps used to plug present gaps in our scientific knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 霍金的神是一個被用來填補我們的科學知識縫隙的神。

sentences.english: TimeTravel_0 : are you familiar with black holes and Stephen Halking?
sentences.chinese: 你熟悉黑洞和史蒂芬。霍金嗎？

sentences.english: Professor Hawkins suffers from motor neurone disease.
sentences.chinese: 霍金教授身患運動神經元疾病。

sentences.english: Although space travel, according to Hawking, shouldn’t be the preserve of science-fiction.
sentences.chinese: 然而，據霍金說，太空旅行不會侷限於科幻小說。

sentences.english: Hodgkinson asserts educational leadership to be a moral art firmly.
sentences.chinese: 霍金森堅決主張，教育領導是一種道德藝術。

sentences.english: Hawking's comments have ignited a fightback from religious leaders.
sentences.chinese: 霍金的評論已經點燃了從宗教領袖反擊。

sentences.english: He was quite impressed with the Universiade venues and service.
sentences.chinese: 對於大運會的場館和服務，霍金森印象深刻。

definition: "A Brief History of Time" by Stephen Hawking
Newton (name)/Sir Isaac Newton (1642-1727), British mathematician and physicist
Chen-Ning Franklin Yang (1922-), theoretical physicist, co-developer of Yang-Mills gauge theory, 1957 Nobel laureate
Alan Turing (1912-1954), English mathematician, considered as the father of computer science
Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher

pinyin: tian1 ti3 wu4 li3 xue2 jia1
